Event.0: Historic win in Malaysian general election by opposition coalition Pakatan Harapan led by 92 year old former Prime Minister Dr. Mahathir bin Mohamad, defeating Prime Minister Najib Razak and ending 61 years of rule by the Barisan Nasional coalition
Event.1: British hairstylist and entrepreneur Vidal Sassoon, who created individualized haircuts featuring stark geometric angles and precise scissor cuts that complemented each woman's bone structure and natural hair texture, died in Los Angeles.
Event.2: "The View" former co-host Star Jones (46) divorces investment banker Al Reynolds (39) after three-and-a-half years of marriage
Event.3: Accra Sports Stadium Disaster: 129 Ghanian football fans die in a stampede caused by the firing of teargas by police following a decision by the referee in a crucial match between arch-rivals Accra Hearts of Oak and Kumasi Asante Kotoko
Event.4: Actor Tom Cruise (27) weds actress Mimi Rogers (33)
Event.5: The U.S. House Judiciary Committee launched a formal impeachment investigation of President Richard M. Nixon.
Event.6: Actress Lana Turner marries for the 8th time to Ronald Dante
Event.7: The Beatles sign their 1st contract with EMI Parlophone
Event.8: US becomes the first country to legalize the birth control pill
Event.9: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration approved the first birth control pill.
Event.10: "Vertigo", American film noir psychological thriller directed by Alfred Hitchcock, starring Jimmy Stewart and Kim Novak, is released
Event.11:
Billy Joel
American musician
was born
Event.12: World War II: The Soviet Union marks Victory Day
Event.13: Physicist Robert Hofstadter (27) weds Nancy Givan
Event.14: British intelligence at Bletchley Park breaks German spy codes after capturing Enigma machines aboard the weather ship Muenchen
Event.15: American track-and-field athlete Ralph Boston, the first man to jump more than 27 feet (8.23 metres), was born in Laurel, Mississippi.
Event.16: Seven months after invading Ethiopia and driving Emperor Haile Selassie I into exile, Italy annexed Ethiopia as part of Italian East Africa.
Event.17:
Albert Finney
British actor
was born
Event.18:
Alan Bennett
British playwright
was born
Event.19: American television interviewer and reporter Mike Wallace—who, while on the show 60 Minutes, became known for his aggressive and bruising style—was born.
Event.20: The first Australian Parliament opens in Melbourne, though the first working session will not be until 21 May
Event.21: President Andrew Johnson issues a proclamation declaring armed resistance in the South is virtually at an end; this is the commonly accepted end date of the American Civil War
Event.22: Dramatist J.M. Barrie—best known for Peter Pan, the title character of which is an eternal boy—was born in Kirriemuir, Angus, Scotland.
Event.23:
J.M. Barrie
Scottish author
was born
Event.24: American abolitionist John Brown was born in Torrington, Connecticut.
Event.25:
John Brown
American abolitionist
was born
Event.26:
Fourth and final voyage of Christopher Columbus launched
On this day in 1502, master navigator and admiral Christopher Columbus, long considered the “discoverer” of the New World, set sail from Cádiz, Spain, on his fourth and final voyage, hoping to find a passage to Asia.
Event.27: Treaty of Windsor between Portugal and England (oldest diplomatic alliance in the world still in force)
